hints.label: prop-cst-causal-set-axioms
hints.title: CST Satisfies Bombelli-Lee-Meyer-Sorkin Axioms
hints.content:
46: :label: prop-cst-causal-set-axioms
47: 
48: **Source:** [13_E_cst_ig_lattice_qft.md § 1.1, lines 133-145]
49: 
50: The Causal Spacetime Tree $\mathcal{T} = (\mathcal{E}, E_{\text{CST}}, \prec)$ satisfies the axiomatic requirements for a causal set in quantum gravity:
51: 
52: **CS1 (Partial Order):** The ancestry relation $\prec$ is irreflexive, transitive, and acyclic.
53: 
54: **Proof:** By construction (Chapter 13), CST edges represent parent-child relations $e_i \to e_j$ with $t^{\rm b}_j = t^{\rm d}_i$. This defines a directed acyclic graph (DAG):
55: - **Irreflexive:** No episode is its own ancestor
56: - **Transitive:** If $e_i \prec e_j$ and $e_j \prec e_k$, then $e_i \prec e_k$ by genealogy
57: - **Acyclic:** Time flows forward; no closed timelike curves
58: 
59: **CS2 (Local Finiteness):** Causal intervals $I(e, e') = \{e'' : e \prec e'' \prec e'\}$ are finite.
60: 
61: **Proof:** Each episode has finite lifetime and finite number of descendants between any two time points. The alive set $|\mathcal{A}(t)| = N < \infty$ bounds the number of episodes per time slice.
62: 
63: **CS3 (Manifoldlikeness):** Episode density approximates spacetime volume.
64: 
65: **Proof:** From Chapter 14, Theorem 14.4.1, the density of episodes per unit volume converges to the Riemannian volume measure $\sqrt{\det g(x)} dx$ in the continuum limit.

hints.label: prop-cst-global-time
hints.title: CST Admits Global Time Function
hints.content:
75: :label: prop-cst-global-time
76: 
77: **Source:** [13_E_cst_ig_lattice_qft.md § 1.2, lines 149-171]
78: 
79: The CST is **globally hyperbolic**: there exists a continuous function $t : \mathcal{E} \to \mathbb{R}$ such that:
80: 
81: $$
82: e \prec e' \implies t(e) < t(e')
83: 
84: $$
85: 
86: **Explicit construction:** Use death time $t(e) = t^{\rm d}_e$.
87: 
88: **Proof:** By construction, CST edges $e_i \to e_j$ satisfy $t^{\rm b}_j = t^{\rm d}_i$, so:
89: 
90: $$
91: e_i \to e_j \implies t^{\rm d}_i < t^{\rm d}_j
92: 
93: $$
94: 
95: Transitivity of $\prec$ extends this to all ancestors/descendants. ∎

hints.label: def-effective-causal-speed
hints.title: Effective Speed of Causation
hints.content:
101: :label: def-effective-causal-speed
102: 
103: **Source:** [13_E_cst_ig_lattice_qft.md § 1.3, lines 187-213]
104: 
105: From cloning dynamics (Chapter 3), spatial perturbation $\Delta \mathbf{x} \sim \mathcal{N}(0, \delta^2 I)$ over episode duration $\tau_e$ defines:
106: 
107: $$
108: c_{\text{eff}} = \frac{\delta}{\langle \tau \rangle}
109: 
110: $$
111: 
112: where:
113: - $\delta$: Cloning noise scale (Chapter 3, Definition 3.2.2.2)
114: - $\langle \tau \rangle$: Mean episode duration
115: 
116: **Lightcone condition:** Episode $e'$ is in the causal future of $e$ only if:
117: 
118: $$
119: e \prec e' \implies d_g(\mathbf{x}_e, \mathbf{x}_{e'}) \leq c_{\text{eff}} (t_{e'} - t_e)
120: 
121: $$
